message: Does django-flash work with the admin app? http://djangoflash.destaquenet.com/
Also I'd be interested if it worked with disqus' Nexus drop-in admin replacement
work how? like letting you add flashes in the admin?
it only uses session storage so you'd need to write a nexus module for editing it I think
@markpasc yeah, to the admin, like while editing models or the like.
You might just need to override the right admin template. I haven't tried it.
yeah, dunno that is' that important, but i was curious

What does django-flash offer that the built-in django.contrib.messages doesn't? I think django-flash was one of the apps that provided the inspiration (and maybe even some code?) for contrib.messages; they appear to have pretty much the same functionality.
@steveivy ah, so showing your flashes as you view the admin?
I know @leah wrote an extension to django-flash, not sure what more it does exactly
huh. don't think i'd seen contrib.messages. /me goes to look...
neat, looks like it's all built-in, i just didn't know where to look :)
Oh yeah, that's so. I forgot the last project I was messing with django-flash for was started with 1.1.
